result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony J Olla was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.
Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.

Conditions of Probation to be determined by Agent.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

supervisions.notes: With Huber. Release for standard condtions, commencing forthwith. Sentence credit of 84 days were granted.
Costs previously imposed were converted to a civil judgment.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Anthony J Olla in court with Attorney Daniel H Sanders.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Grant Scaife appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Case called for sentencing.  State does not have an amended information prepared.  State will be amending to misdemeanor possession charge.  Court orders the state to file the amended information by the end of day (8/11/16).  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Sanders makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  WITHHELD SENTENCE:   

TERM OF PROBATION:  6 MONTHS

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:      -    To be determined by agent

COSTS:  $243.00  (to be paid as a condition of probation)

***Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations ***
